title: Vectorized formulas — fmls
text: expansion pattern allows instructions covariates included different formulas. , assuming x1, x2, x3 covariates... $$y = x1 + x2 + x3$$ Direct: $$y = x1 + x2 + x3$$ Seqential: $$y = x1$$ $$y = x1 + x2$$ $$y = x1 + x2 + x3$$ Parallel: $$y = x1$$ $$y = x2$$ $$y = x3$$

title: Vectorized formulas — fmls
text: Specific roles variable plays within formula. particular importance, serve special terms can effect formula interpreted. Formulas can condensed applying specific role individual runes function/wrapper. example, y ~ .x(x1) + x2 + x3. signify x1 specific role exposure. Grouped variables slightly different placed together hierarchy tier. indicate group tier, shortcut can integer following .g. number given, assumed tier. Ex: y ~ x1 + .g1(x2) + .g1(x3) Warning: single shortcut can applied variable within formula directly.

title: Vectorized formulas — fmls
text: single argument, e.g. tm.formula() method, identify variable X exposure, formula given term interest LHS, description instruction RHS. look like role = X ~ "exposure". arguments dispatched objects plural, e.g. containing multiple terms, formula() placed within list(). example, role argument written: role = list(X ~ "exposure", M ~ "mediator", C ~ "confounder") implementation details can seen implementation list_of_formulas().

title: Subgroup Forest Plot — tbl_forest
text: Subgroup Forest Plot

title: Subgroup Forest Plot — tbl_forest
text: x Class forge object models fit formula Identifies relationships interest, LHS representing outcome, RHS representing exposure. vars Character vector variables interest. can either grouping variables, can performed interaction terms (based models included originally). parameter interaction changed TRUE, create joint confidence intervals presence absence interaction term. interaction Logical value identify model attempt use interaction terms . Currently accepts binary/dichotomous variables interaction term. columns Additional columns help describe subgroup models. least one column selected list. sequence listed #'   reflect sequence shown table. current options : beta = point estimate value, odds ratio hazard ratio conf = inclusion confidence interval (presumed 95%-ile) n = number observations model group example: list(beta ~ "Hazard", conf ~ "95% CI" n ~ ".")" flip Determine odds hazard ratio shown reciprocal values. Instead decreasing hazard every unit increase, describes increasing hazard every unit decrease. axis Argument help modify forest plot . list-formula following parameters. named, function attempt "guess" optimal parameters. options : title = label title column describing forest plot lim = x-axis limits breaks = x-axis tick marks break points numbers int = x-axis intercept lab = label x-axis scale = defaults continuous, may also use log transformation well c("continuous", "log") example: list(title ~ "Decreasing Hazard", lab ~ "HR (95% CI)) width Describes width column list two-sided formulas. RHS decimal reflecting percent column take entire table. forest plot usually given 30% width. example: list(n ~ .1, forest ~ 0.3)

title: Create vectorized terms — tm
code: tm(x = unspecified(), ...)  # S3 method for character tm(   x,   role = character(),   side = character(),   label = character(),   group = integer(),   type = character(),   distribution = character(),   description = character(),   transformation = character(),   ... )  # S3 method for formula tm(   x,   role = formula(),   label = formula(),   group = formula(),   type = formula(),   distribution = formula(),   description = formula(),   transformation = formula(),   ... )  # S3 method for fmls tm(x, ...)  # S3 method for tm tm(x, ...)  # S3 method for default tm(x = unspecified(), ...)  is_tm(x)

title: Create vectorized terms — tm
text: x object can coerced tm object. role Specific roles variable plays within formula. particular importance, serve special terms can effect formula interpreted. Please see Roles section details. options roles : outcome exposure predictor confounder mediator interaction strata group unknown side side formula term . Options c("left", "right", "meta", "unknown"). meta option refers term may apply globally terms. label Display-quality label describing variable group Grouping variable name modeling placing terms together. integer value given identify group term . hierarchy 1 → n incrementally. type Type variable, either categorical (qualitative) continuous (quantitative) distribution variable specifically subcategorized, e.g. ordinal, continuous, dichotomous, etc description Option descriptions definitions needed tm, potentially part data dictionary transformation Modification term applied combining data

title: volundr 0.0.0.9000
text: functions currently stable, continue similar inputs outputs. time, expansion use. hypothesize() creates individual hypotheses tested create_study() initializes data structure mapping hypothesis objects add_hypothesis() adds existing study object construct_map() creates corresponding component tables underlying study object extract_models() returns tidy raw versions analyzed study
